page.title: 12Fire Service, Haltwhistle
page.content: Haltwhistle has its own fire station with one fire engine. It is manned entirely by part time firemen who are paid a yearly retainer and for each call out. On Tuesdays a fire practice is held beside the big tower in the station yard. Children love to watch. The part time firemen all work near the fire station and carry their own personal alarms. When the alarm goes off they can be seen running, driving, or cycling at top speed to the station their tools left lying on the ground. Chimney fires and hay barn fires are the most common reasons for being called out. In outlying districts the lack of a mains water supply often makes their job very difficult. Every year the firemen hold a dance to raise funds for the station. Last November they supervised a town bonfire and fireworks display.
